Domain Objects¶

The tempodb.protocol.objects module contains definitions for all the domain objects in the TempoDB API.

class tempodb.protocol.objects.DataPoint(json_text, response, tz=None)[source]¶

Represents a single data point in a series. To construct these objects in user code, use the class method from_data().

classmethod from_data(time, value, series_id=None, key=None, tz=None)[source]¶

Create a DataPoint object from data, rather than a JSON object or string. This should be used by user code to construct DataPoints from Python-based data like Datetime objects and floats.

The series_id and key arguments are only necessary if you are doing a multi write, in which case those arguments can be used to specify which series the DataPoint belongs to.

If needed, the tz argument should be an Olsen database compliant string specifying the time zone for this DataPoint. This argument is most often used internally when reading data from TempoDB.

Parameters:
  • time (ISO8601 string or Datetime) – the point in time for this reading
  • value (int or float) – the value for this reading
  • series_id (string) – (optional) a series ID for this point
  • key (string) – (optional) a key for this point
  • tz (string) – (optional) a timezone for this point
Return type:

DataPoint
from_json(json_text)[source]¶

Deserialize a JSON object into this object. This method will check that the JSON object has the required keys and will set each of the keys in that JSON object as an instance attribute of this object.

Parameters:json_text (dict or string) – the JSON text or object to deserialize from
Raises ValueError:
 if the JSON object lacks an expected key
Return type:None
to_dictionary()[source]¶

Serialize an object into dictionary form. Useful if you have to serialize an array of objects into JSON. Otherwise, if you call the to_json() method on each object in the list and then try to dump the array, you end up with an array with one string.

to_json()[source]¶

Serialize an object to JSON based on its “properties” class attribute.

Return type:string
class tempodb.protocol.objects.DataSet(json_text, response)[source]¶

Represents a data set returned using the /data resource in the TempoDB API. Depending on the original API call, some attributes of this object (such as rollup) could be None.

class tempodb.protocol.objects.JSONSerializable(json_text, response)[source]¶

Base class for objects that are serializable to and from JSON. This class defines default methods for serializing each way that use the class’s “properties” class variable to determine what should be serialized or deserialized. For example:

class MySerialized(JSONSerializable)
    properties = ['foo', 'bar']

This would define a class that expects to have the ‘foo’ and ‘bar’ keys in JSON data and would likewise serialize a JSON object with those keys.

The base constructor calls the from_json() method, which enforces these constraints for object construction. If you override this constructor (for example, to provide static initialization of some variables), it is highly recommended that the subclass constructor call this constructor at some point through super().

Parameters:json_text (string) – the JSON string to deserialize from
from_json(json_text)[source]¶

Deserialize a JSON object into this object. This method will check that the JSON object has the required keys and will set each of the keys in that JSON object as an instance attribute of this object.

Parameters:json_text (dict or string) – the JSON text or object to deserialize from
Raises ValueError:
 if the JSON object lacks an expected key
Return type:None
to_dictionary()[source]¶

Serialize an object into dictionary form. Useful if you have to serialize an array of objects into JSON. Otherwise, if you call the to_json() method on each object in the list and then try to dump the array, you end up with an array with one string.

to_json()[source]¶

Serialize an object to JSON based on its “properties” class attribute.

Return type:string
class tempodb.protocol.objects.Nothing(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Used to represent empty responses. This class should not be used directly in user code.

class tempodb.protocol.objects.Rollup(json_text, response)[source]¶

Represents the rollup information returned from the TempoDB API when the API calls demands it.

class tempodb.protocol.objects.Series(json_text, response)[source]¶

Represents a Series object from the TempoDB API. Series objects are serialized to and from JSON using the to_json() and from_json() methods.

class tempodb.protocol.objects.SeriesSet(json_text, response)[source]¶

Represents a set of Series objects as returned by the list series TempoDB API endpoint. The SeriesSet exposes a cursor that can be iterated over to examine each series return by the API.

class tempodb.protocol.objects.SingleValue(json_text, response)[source]¶

Represents a data set returned by calling the single value endpoint of the TempoDB API. This domain object is not cursored, so it is implemented separately from the more generic DataSet object.

class tempodb.protocol.objects.Summary(json_text, response)[source]¶

Represents the summary received from the TempoDB API when a data read request is sent. The properties are summary statistics for the dataset returned.
